ygData.subject: Re: Lost Dugeons of Norrath
ygData.msgSnippet: Paid a few extra bucks and bought it from AllaKhazam.  So I got a CD and the easy of loading it that way.  I also got the pack of Abu-Kar and did the quest to
ygData.messageBody:
Paid a few extra bucks and bought it from AllaKhazam. So I got a CD
and the easy of loading it that way. I also got the pack of Abu-Kar
and did the quest to upgrade it. The Dungeons have a D&D feel, but
the whole system feels like AO to me. But the XP and PP are great.
And some of the rewards are outta sight!

Tuldayen Grimblade
Pathfinder of Tunare
Terris-Thule

--- In EverQuest@yahoogroups.com, "McDonald, Maureen L"
<Maureen.L.McDonald@e...> wrote:
> Wow!
> You are a fortunate individual. If I downloaded a game at work I'd
> better have a resume ready! Sad thing is, I think our network would
be
> great for LAN parties, what a waste :p
>
> _____
>
> From: Enie [mailto:dawn_marie@m...]
> Sent: Thursday, September 11, 2003 10:41 AM
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [EverQuest] Re: Lost Dugeons of Norrath
>
>
> Wooohooo! I brought my laptop to work and downloaded LDoN on the T1
> line and it only took 27 minutes, far cry from 23 hours LOL. I am
> headed home for lunch to play :)
>
> --- In EverQuest@yahoogroups.com, Su <suceress@d...> wrote:
> >
> > Yeah. If you opt to get the download only version you might want
to
> suck up
> > to a friend to burn copies of the files onto a CD and send to you.
> > I was shocked when I found a woman in the hardware store in this
> small town
> > who actually plays EQ.
> > luv,
> > -Su
> >
> > Awhile back they had a patch where you could opt to download it
in
> smaller
> > chunks as they became available... all you had to do was click
on
> yes.
> > This is exactly what they were tryign to avoid because the
network
> traffic
> > ties up the bandwidth when people do this and nobody can connect.
> >
> > T1 will still take a good chunk of time, but not an entire day.
> >
> > Wulfric
> >
> >
> >
> >

laptop
